title: Angular momentum - change in car angular momentum

content.question: The diagram shows an amusement park ride that consists of a car of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> connected to a motor by a rigid arm of length <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math>. The motor spins the arm and the car moves in a vertical circle. In Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, the car is at the bottom of the circle with a tangential velocity of magnitude <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. In Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, the car has moved clockwise along the circle through an angle <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math>, and has tangential velocity of magnitude <math alttext="v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, where <math alttext="v sub 2 is greater than v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. Which of the following is equal to the change in angular momentum of the car about the rotation axis between Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="m R, times open parenthesis, v sub 2 minus v sub 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi><mi>R</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="one half m R, times open parenthesis, v sub 2, end sub, squared minus v sub 1, end sub, squared, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mi>m</mi><mi>R</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msubsup><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mo>−</mo><msubsup><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></msubsup><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="m g R, times open parenthesis, 1 minus the cosine of theta, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi><mi>g</mi><mi>R</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mi>cos</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>θ</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="m v sub 2, end sub, R times, the sine of theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mi>R</mi><mi>sin</mi><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi>θ</mi></math>
